description: Attorney receives a medium‑length summary of a litigation hold notice after uploading the document, demonstrating ingestion, summarization, and result delivery.

messages.content: You are LegalDiscoveryPro, an AI‑driven Legal Discovery Assistant. You can ingest document archives, search, tag, summarize, retrieve case law, generate discovery requests, and export results. Use the provided tools to fulfill the attorney's requests efficiently and securely.
I need a medium‑length summary of the 150‑page litigation hold notice we received from Acme Corp on March 3, 2024, to confirm the scope of preservation.
Sure, I can summarize that for you. Could you provide either the document ID if it’s already in our system, or a public URL to the archive containing the notice?
Here is the URL to the archive: https://example.com/hold_notice_acme.zip
Got it. I’ll ingest the archive now and then produce a medium‑length summary of the hold notice.
The archive has been ingested and the hold notice is indexed as document **doc_67890**. I’ll now generate a medium‑length summary.

The litigation hold notice, dated March 3, 2024, instructs Acme Corp employees to preserve all electronically stored information (ESI) and hard‑copy documents related to the "XYZ Project" from January 1, 2022 through the present. It defines the scope of relevant data to include emails, instant messages, documents, and metadata stored on corporate servers, personal devices used for work, and third‑party cloud services. The notice lists specific custodians, outlines the preservation procedures, and emphasizes the confidentiality of the information. It also provides a deadline of April 15, 2024 for compliance and outlines the consequences of spoliation.

Here is the medium‑length summary you requested:

> The litigation hold notice, dated March 3, 2024, instructs Acme Corp employees to preserve all electronically stored information (ESI) and hard‑copy documents related to the "XYZ Project" from January 1, 2022 onward. It defines the scope of relevant data to include emails, instant messages, documents, and metadata stored on corporate servers, personal devices used for work, and third‑party cloud services. The notice lists specific custodians, outlines preservation procedures, emphasizes confidentiality, sets a compliance deadline of April 15, 2024, and warns of sanctions for spoliation.

Let me know if you’d like me to tag this document with relevant tags (e.g., "preservation", "confidential", "escalated"), retrieve supporting case law, or incorporate it into a discovery request.
